website_summaries.verdict: For large amounts of nutmeg or a really fine grind, you may prefer this electric spice and nut grinder from Cuisinart.
pros: Push-top lid for simple on/off control.Bowl holds 90 grams
Grinds a variety of large, hard spices
Grinds more finely than hand-cranked grinders
cons: Stainless steel container is not air tight, so finely ground spices can blow into the bottom of the unit and land on the counter

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!! Lots of malfunctions
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! 1. The blade is not locked air tight onto the base, so my spice leaks everywhere on the space between the cup and the base. 2. Motor dies extremely easily. I've tried to revive it by putting it in the fridge/freezer to cool down the motor, and it works again. But the motor is just too weak. 3. There's a malfunction one day, the cup and the base completely locked together and inseparable. The blade won't turn. Bye bye The grinder really grinds things into powder, but there are better grinder out there. This is not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 4 months; "warranty" is a joke
customer_reviews.text: I loved this little grinder - it was so handy for nuts and cinnamon; but it abruptly stopped working two days ago and doesn't show any signs of life. The "warranty" - which I wish I had known before I purchased it - says to, first, ship the product on my own expense to NJ, which will be about $15; then add a check for $10 more for Cuisinart for "shipping and handling". This all is for them just to start looking at the broken grinder. So, like, spend $25 more on something that's worth $35 new and that I am not even sure can, or will be, repaired. This is a shame, not a warranty.
customer_reviews.author: N O

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: I've been a customer on Amazon for over 16 years, and in all that time, I have only returned one item. Make that two now. As with other previous reviewers, it works, but only the aluminum cup is detachable while the blade -- which is attached permanently to the cup -- stays locked, making it impossible to take the cup off to wash it. Only used it twice. I could still use it since it does work, but I can't wash it in dishwasher since the blade doesn't want to unlock. Very poor design... going to buy a spice and nut grinder now from a different company.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE !!!
customer_reviews.text: POOR PERFORMANCE, OVERHEATS EASILY, MISSES A LOT OF NUTS AND NOW IN TOP OF ALL THAT, THE CUP ITS STUCK, THEREFORE UNABLE TO REMOVE AND CLEAN. CUISINART HAS A GOOD REPUTATION FOR KITCHEN DEVICES BUT IN THIS CASE THEY'VE TO GO BACK TO THE DRAWING TABLE FOR SURE !!!
customer_reviews.author: PACOMODA

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Engineered
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product as I love my Cuisinart Food Processor but spice grinder has few pros and many cons as I've listed below. I am still searching for a good spice grinder. Pros- -Quiet -Powerful Motor -Looks nice Cons- -Blades sit too high -Blade assembly is not sealed so spices leak out the bottom -No gasket on the plastic top so spices leak out the top -Grind is not even or fine enough
customer_reviews.author: Chris G.

customer_reviews.title: Grinds Unevenly. And how do the grinds end up underneath the cup?
customer_reviews.text: What I like most about this grinder is that it is not as loud as other grinders i've used. Unfortunately, that's where my "likes" stop. Coffee (or whatever) is ground unevenly - after running for 20 seconds which is ample for less than 1/2 cup of beans. I have included a picture that shows that there is fine grinds at the bottom with coarser grinds towards the top. Additionally, underneath the base of the cup there are residual grinds. Forget ever doing anything that has any moisture. Overall, it is disappointing that Cuisinart didn't get it right. If I could return it i would. Will probably go back to the basic KRUPS grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Maka Nani

customer_reviews.title: Started smoking during first use!?
customer_reviews.text: This grinder started smoking during its first use so we unplugged it and will send it back. We will continue to use our old coffee grinder instead.
customer_reviews.author: TD Karantsalis

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: A good balance of weight and size, this little grinder is great! Flax seed was done in under 10 seconds with 1/4 cup. This s a small grinder, and I wouldn't put in much more than 1/3 of a cup or so. The item has a beautiful stainless and black plastic shell and a pretty heavy duty blade. The opening on the bottom of the unit will permit small particles through and a good wipe down on the inside of mounted part will be needed after each use, but that's a small price to pay for how well this grinds. I strongly recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: Fanamazon

customer_reviews.title: Good for fine grinding, not for chopping nuts.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because the plastic manual nut grinders were cracking at the threads where the top attached to the bottom. I got a glass nut grinder, but it took some gluing to keep the top together, it skid around the countertop, and it was just hard to run the crank. But I like to grind up filberts medium-coarse for waffles, nut bread, etc. This electric grinder pulverizes the nuts to a fine powder. Probably fine for some uses, but not the texture I'm looking for. So calling it a "nut grinder" is not consistent with the results we expect from other nut grinders.
customer_reviews.author: DHStraayer

customer_reviews.title: Small capacity - motor smells like its about to burn out
customer_reviews.text: I used the grinder once to grind some whole coriander seeds... although the grinding bowl looks large, the max fill line is very small... took me 15 minutes to grind a cup of coriander. When I was done - instead of smelling the sweet smell of fresh ground spices, all I could smell was the fatiguing motor... I doubt I will use this grinder again - better off buying a different product. Considering this was one of the more expensive grinders in its size range - I am very disappointed with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Peter T

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable for volumes of pepper
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a number of pepper and spice grinders and if you have recipes with more than a tablespoon of pepper, you need this. I make my own BBQ rubs and this is the only way to get enough fresh "ground" pepper. It might be finer than you'd get from an adjustable grinder, but it's much better than using pre-ground pepper. It comes with a lid for the inner chamber, but the blade assembly is too lose for it to be an air tight seal. Mine might be an assembly issue, but when it's on the base the blade is firmly in place and works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Brad C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but too much spice escapes the cup
customer_reviews.text: Chops very well, but leaves quite a bit of powdered spice around the inside of the grinder, not in the cup. I expected a much better "seal" between the cup and the body of the grinder. This makes it much more difficult to clean (especially things like very hot chilies).
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: This is not a spice grinder. I tried with cinnamon, cloves and cardamom with very little quantity ended with smoke from the motor for the first use itself. I am returning the iteam.
customer_reviews.author: Hi

customer_reviews.title: Easy but not consistent grinding
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mom as she was looking for one for quite a while. This grinder is easy to use as it’s pretty lightweight, my mom with her arthritic wrists finds it pretty light. Also she doesn’t like appliances with too many parts...this is pretty simplistic in that manner. Only thing is that the grinding is not the best. It doesn’t grind consistently. There are some that get grinded coarse and some fine. So it gets some minus points for that.
customer_reviews.author: VD

customer_reviews.title: Grinds well, can overheat.
customer_reviews.text: It ground really well, but after only 8 oz of spices it died. *EDIT* It turns out that it overheated. After it sitting for 30 minutes, it worked fine again. As I mentioned before, it grind very well. Seems to have plenty of power. If grinding hard spices like cinnamon or ginger, whack then with a hammer before putting them in a grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: went down in quality
customer_reviews.text: I owned a previous version of this grinder, which finally broke. This version, as others have stated, is not sealed (i.e. the blade assembly is loosely attached, allowing spices to slip between the blade assembly and the metal housing, getting powder everywhere). Still effective, but not nearly as happy with this model as I was with the old model.
customer_reviews.author: Josh English

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is totally awesome. So worth it to have a separate grinder for spices after using the coffee one and having to rinse it out all the time, not to mention something that is more specifically for spices and has a groovy lid to boot. Looking forward to grinding all kinds of spices like cinnamon sticks that I've never tried with a grinder, but so far it pulverizes peppercorn to a fine dust in seconds. Big thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best bet if you want an awsome and easy to use grinder
customer_reviews.text: A must have in your kitchen. I have it now for about a year and it is so easy to use, makes a fine powder of all the nuts and salt crystals or any dry ingredients so happy with my little grinder. I trued 3 grinders from different brands before this and they died in a month or so.. this one keeps going i even throw the metal cup and top cover in my dishwasher. So easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Isha

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use is not great..
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly grinds large quantities to a coarse powder. Small quantities not so well. When the plastic cover is placed over the grinding container, there is a gap on the top - this allows powder to come out and settle outside of the grinder. Retracting the power cord is a challenge....lot of pushing is involved...not easy. Kept it anyway...not completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: val t.

customer_reviews.title: Removable cup doesn’t!!!
customer_reviews.text: The removable cup will remove once or twice then gets stuck on you can’t remove the removable cup so it is very difficult to clean seems you can’t put the entire thing in the dishwasher. Don’t buy if you want it for the removable cup like I did!
customer_reviews.author: Weston J. Howland

customer_reviews.title: Not good for coffee
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I know it says it's a spice and nut grinder, but there were several comments on using it for coffee, so I tried it. The bowl is too large and the coffee spins to the outside, leaving the only the grounds in the center of the cup circulating. Will probably just give it away or something.
customer_reviews.author: Starman

customer_reviews.title: Broke on 2nd use
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for a second time today to make some oat flour and the plastic around the blade broke! This created quite a mess. I am so disappointed cos i had higher expectations of cuisinart as a brand. It is also extremely noisy - more than any other blender i've used. In an ideal world, they'd make good and refund me. However, it is impossible to get in touch with a human to explain the concern to so I'm stuck with an unusable product.
customer_reviews.author: Dhawal S.

customer_reviews.title: This blender does exactly what it's supposed to - grind tough spices.
customer_reviews.text: Had trie several other blenders - this one works. Only concern is the plastic cup - would recommend this be turned into glass. After a few months anticipate this to be "sandblasted" by hard spices- effectively placing micro plastics into your spices (which was one of my concerns with other products).
customer_reviews.author: p kay

customer_reviews.title: Solid Kitchen Tool
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool and have used it regularly since I got it to prep herbs and spices, and it is such a life and time saver! The ONLY thing I dislike about this tool is the way that it collects residue from whatever you're grinding at the base of the lid. I know this seems nit-picky but it is something easily fixed with a better lid (or base) design
customer_reviews.author: shrksb8

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: OK, it's a "spice" grinder. But, unlike older versions of this same model, it leaks any liquid through the hub.
customer_reviews.author: Parsifal

customer_reviews.title: This works great for crushing pills!
customer_reviews.text: I have worsening arthritis in my thumbs, and I have to crush medications for clients every day. I was checking reviews for different pill crushers, and one reviewer mentioned this product. It does a great job. At first, it creates a cloud of powder, but I just hold the cup/cover on snugly for a minute or so, then quickly switch it with the plastic cap that seals it shut, and it's good to go. It crushes more finely than I ever could with a hand crusher.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy O

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Used it once and it did what it was supposed to without a problem. Second time I used it smoke started to come out of the hole where the lead exits the appliance and a metallic grinding sound started. I checked that the bowl was seated properly (it was) but it continued to smoke and make an awful noise so turned it off and sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Fantasy Fan

customer_reviews.title: Broke during first use
customer_reviews.text: The gaskets got torn up during the first use - a simple task of grinding cumin. The instructions gave no indication of how to assemble the grinder cup and gaskets, so I don't know if it was user error, design flaw, shoddy construction, or a combination thereof. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Tanner

customer_reviews.title: COFFEE,Spice & Nut
customer_reviews.text: I put 40gr of coffee beans in the container, pulse quickly ~15 times (total time10 seconds+/-), add one more 10 second long pulse and I get perfectly ground coffee for my #2 paper filtered drip pot. The ground beans are not heated like some reviewers claim.and they're fairly consistent in size. You can easily vary the coarseness of the grind by varying the number and length of pulses. The cover is transparent and easily removed so you can progressively see the results.. The cup with fixed blade easily screws on and off for washing. It's quiet. It's the right size and price. It's a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: DougChoz

customer_reviews.title: unclear instructions and it seems the bowl should come out ...
customer_reviews.text: unclear instructions and it seems the bowl should come out for cleaning...not well designed..it still works, but the bowl does not sit snuggly in place.
customer_reviews.author: mecaks

customer_reviews.title: Fine powder is what you will get
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to grind up aspirin tablets. An entire bottle of aspirin was totally powdered in 5 - 10 seconds. Works great with complete results, not one small chunk left in the pile.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Brasen

customer_reviews.title: Bowl no longer removeable after fifth use
customer_reviews.text: I order the grinder on 7 September 2014. Received it. Used it four times and loved it. On the fifth time, 25 October 2104, the bowl has become stuck in the base and cannot be removed, so essentially the advantage of clean-up has been removed. The grinder still works, but it is ridiculous for an item to have one of its major selling points fail not two months after you have bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: WHy did I wait so long?
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is ideal for kitchen use and lives up to its description. Works well for very small or larger quantities and is super fast. Clean-up so much easier than other grinders I have used.
customer_reviews.author: James R McFerson

customer_reviews.title: Please add a wet grinding bowel,
customer_reviews.text: Working fine wo far for coffee. Quieter than last grinder. However I do wish it came with a wet grinder bowl like my old grinder. I used t use it all the time for garlic and ginger paste.
customer_reviews.author: BitoMom

customer_reviews.title: Grind Your Own Spices
customer_reviews.text: Love my grinder. I try to buy all my spices whole as they keep longer. It grinds very well. You can't put anything wet in it, though (I tried making pesto-BIG MISTAKE). It is easy to clean and dishwasher safe.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for grinding dried peppers!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome...grinding hot peppers that were previously well dried in a dehydrator grinds the whole pepper down to very fine powder in only a few seconds. I only wish the grinding container could handle a bit larger quantity. But with how fast it grinds, the whole project was done quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Grinder - Caution On Long Grinding Times.
customer_reviews.text: Very good but be sure to use it in short bursts. It is not made for long time running as it will overheat. But if used like grind, pause, grind, pause etc., it will do a great job and last a long time. Highly recommend it. Just don't leave it running for a long 60 second grind as it will overheat.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Lochmiller

customer_reviews.title: This one is amazing though. I through some cin
customer_reviews.text: Our old one finally gave out. RIP little guy. This one is amazing though. I through some cin. in and it chewed right through it. Well built and solid and the storage cap is nice however I don't think I would ever use it. Overall a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: P. G.

customer_reviews.title: Instant Operation and Easy to Clean
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this item and used it only a few times but it exceeded my expectations, so far. Used this to grind up flax seed and spices to be added to flour for homemade pasta. It turned everything into powder in just seconds. I couldn't believe it was done that quickly but when I checked the entire batch was fully done. Extremely easy to clean too.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!
customer_reviews.text: I was used to hassling with a coffee grinder in trying to grind other things. Was disappointed when I looked at the blade in this unit, thought it would be similar. I was very pleasantly surprised when I put some seeds in it. Took just a few seconds to reduce seeds to fine powder. It's best to soak seeds before eating, haven't tried grinding some wet but could always soak-dry-grind...
customer_reviews.author: Radio Buff

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I have ground flax seeds, herbs and spices (including pepper corns). The machine grinds well as long as you don't overload the work bowl. The stainless steel work bowl is nice, previously I ruined a the plastic work bowl in a grinder by grinding cloves; the clove oil caused the plastic to degrade. With stainless steel, this problem is eliminated. There is a small amount of powdered material that escapes the work bowl, but this seems a minor problem. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Randy See

customer_reviews.title: Good product, grinds well.
customer_reviews.text: I have used it for few times. It is easy to use and powerful enough to roasted sichuan peppercorns/ mung beans/ star anise or sesame seed into fine powder evenly. So far no overheat or bogging down problems. I do recommend this grinder.
customer_reviews.author: JY

customer_reviews.title: Pathetic and not recommended again
customer_reviews.text: New update. This thing broke and doesn’t turn on by using 4th time only. Never again. Pathetic and not recommended again. Stay away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Naki Nakvi

customer_reviews.title: High quality, nice storage feature
customer_reviews.text: I have a new rule in my kitchen -- no pre-ground spices. This little machine makes is possible, and it's very worthwhile. Freshly ground spices are much more flavorful, even if the whole spice itself is not so fresh. Particularly good for Indian food (for garam masala). The grinding receptacle has a lid that allows you to store the spices. The device has a small footprint, so it doesn't take up all your counter space. Overall, great choice and reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Ichiji

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Great Spice Grinder, star anise, this thing makes anise powder if you let it. Cinnamon sticks no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Palmerino C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Spices and Seeds
customer_reviews.text: Thank you Cuisinart. I wouldn’t ask you more than this. Perfect item for my long awaited purpose. This is the first day using the item and I don’t have to wait for weeks to give my feedback as I felt confident after the first result.
customer_reviews.author: Tesfaye

customer_reviews.title: Not a good spice grinder
customer_reviews.text: I returned the product because it does not finely grind spices like black pepper very well.
customer_reviews.author: natalie ross

customer_reviews.title: Works well for dehydrated veggies
customer_reviews.text: This grinder works great for dehydrated veggies- so far I've tried it with carrots, celery, garlic, tomatoes, onions, and peppers. It ground it all into a delicious spice blend. The big cup is nice, and it's nice to be able to remove the cup to wash.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hill

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: After the second use, the blade became loose and started leaking spices at the bottom. It's a hit or miss. Boooo :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still have to do it outside but it's so fast and makes a pretty goo fine powder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to do my hot peppers. Still have to do it outside but it's so fast and makes a pretty goo fine powder. I haven't tried any other food item but the peppers. Yes, seeds and all. My Serrano pepper powder was awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Tmary

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work.  Obviously very cheaply made.  Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: Tried grinding coffee beans - What a mess! Then I tried grinding chunks of Romano cheese. It stopped the motor cold. Or should I say hot. Poor design and not enough power.
customer_reviews.author: William C.

customer_reviews.title: Simply Stopped Working After 4 Months
customer_reviews.text: Ground contents leak thru the bottom of the grinding cup and build up underneath. Cover seal is not tight so very dusty to use. Simply stopped coming on after about 4 months. No troubleshooting to fix that and waited forever on product support line
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi The Farmer

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite cooks tools!
customer_reviews.text: This spice grinder is so much better then the Krupps coffee grinder I was using to grind spices. Since the main components are dishwasher safe, it is much easier to clean and gets used oh so much more. I even used this to mince a bunch of fresh garlic and it made short work of this task. Why did I wait so long to invest in this necessary kitchen tool?
customer_reviews.author: Ladyjn13

customer_reviews.title: Has stood the test of Time
customer_reviews.text: I have used mine often for spices, and have put this machine through it's paces. I researched spice grinders before making this purchase and I have been completely satisfied with its performance
customer_reviews.author: Spaghetti Eddi

customer_reviews.title: Really Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This grinder has made my life so much easier. I especially appreciate it when I'm grinding turmeric, which is like grinding rocks. This grinder turns it into a fine powder and that alone makes it worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: wen313

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about the Cuisinart SG-10 Electric Spice and Nut Grinder. And the first couple of times I used it to make paprika from home-grown dried peppers, it worked great. Easy to clean too. But the third time I used it for the same purpose, smoke started coming from the motor. I have gone back to my tried and true, 25 year old, cracked, yet still going strong, coffee grinder. This spice grinder just isn't strong or tough enough to do what it is meant to do.
customer_reviews.author: HollyHolly

customer_reviews.title: Great Grinder but now Broken!
customer_reviews.text: I love this spice grinder. It is cute, easy to use and easy to clean. Until it breaks. I've used it maybe 10 times max and now the bowl won't release from the base which makes it harder to clean. I contacted Cuisinart but they wouldn't replace it as it was out of warranty. They had no other solutions.
customer_reviews.author: Nili S. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is designed to do and I've not had any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Got it for commercial use and its working and year now
customer_reviews.author: nil

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Works like advertised. I grind soaked beans, nuts and also cinnemon and dried chickpeas to flour. The outcome is perfect and the grinder pretty quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Grinder for FIle'
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a grinder to make gumbo file' this thing works great. I was concerned it would not grind it fine enough but i was very satisfied with the results. I did remove most of the heavy stems from the leaves and the powder consistency was awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Barrilleaux

customer_reviews.title: Like the other posts have said
customer_reviews.text: Like the other posts have said, the blade part was wiggly so I didn't even try to use it. I knew that the spices would leak out the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Tinkham

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: As a nut grinder it is not the best, but it does work and serve the purpose,
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Donofrio

customer_reviews.title: Grinds well
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second one. I managed to destroy the first one. Had to do without it for a few weeks and return to using a coffee mill. This is much better. And since I also purchased extra cups, I can keep one for savory spices and one for sweet. I sent one to my sister and her husband because they make very, very, strong coffee and this will grind enough for a pot of coffee in one pass -- they were filling a coffee grinder twice per pot.
customer_reviews.author: Meche in Okla

customer_reviews.title: Choose something else.
customer_reviews.text: It looks good and the removable cup are useful, but the reliability is terrible. The motor in it just fried after less than 4 months of use. All I was doing was grinding up a tablespoon or so of black peppercorns, so it's not as if it was overloaded. It started smoking and that was that. The "Heavy-Duty" motor it claims to have is a bit of a poetic license. It also has the disadvantage that it runs slower than other grinders I've used and hence its results tend to be courser than theirs. It's a shame, because I found the removable cup to be useful and easier to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Angel

customer_reviews.title: It works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: This device works great! I'm developing balanced recipes for controlling blood sugar by controlling the insulin response to specific food combinations, for a cookbook that I'm writing and I needed a reliable means of grinding seeds and mixing spices. I ordered this device, the Cuisinart SG-10 Electric Spice-and-Nut Grinder, and was pleased to find that it is perfect for the job. I expect to be mentioning it by name in my book. Howard L. Silverman, Ph.D., D.C.
customer_reviews.author: Howard L. Silverman

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, needs blade options and sealed around blade better
customer_reviews.author: daniel thomason

customer_reviews.title: Does a decent job at what it was intended to ...
customer_reviews.text: Does a decent job at what it was intended to do.. however often times spices end up half powder and half properly grinded (or half ungrinded and half grinded). You really need to push / shake / push / shake etc. in order to get even blends with alot of spices.
customer_reviews.author: CustomerOne

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Little Product
customer_reviews.text: It works well. I did find that a burr grinder preserves more of the seed oils, but this little product is very reliable and works great. When the burr grinder failed I just kept using this - it just keeps working.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. D.

customer_reviews.title: I love this spice grinder
customer_reviews.text: Far superior to a coffee bean grinder. I looked everywhere for an electric spice grinder and even tried a coffee bean grinder (as recommended by many) which spewed spices all over the place. The way this grinder is designed keeps the spices completely inside the bowl so my kitchen counter stayed spice free. Just as important, the spices were ground to perfection. I am so glad I found this and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna D

customer_reviews.title: Cinnamon not cinnabon
customer_reviews.text: I decided to grind my own cinnamon since I love it so much and eat it every day that after a little research about the properties and benefits of cinnamon and it's local for the 'true cinnamon', Sri-Lanka, I also did a little research on the type of grinder I would use as well, and I chose the Cuisinart SG-10 and I love it. It's perfect for me, it grinds quickly, smoothly at the touch of the lid to grind several sticks at a time. I am going to make smooth nut paste next.
customer_reviews.author: tgnao

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Outstanding Design
customer_reviews.text: We're using the grinder for coffee, but I was so impressed by the design of the appliance that I had to write a review. It elegantly eliminates all problems from using a grinder for coffee, from safety to cleanup. It's a joy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Meiners

customer_reviews.title: Motor burned out after only two uses
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions and use this grinder to grind peppercorns purchased in bulk. The grinder motor burned out on the second batch. I did a bit of research and found this is a common problem with this products. Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Makes me want to cook!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! Have used/tried a few other similar products, this by far is the one!
customer_reviews.author: j_90

customer_reviews.title: Star grinder
customer_reviews.text: Perfect grinder- exactly what I needed. Love it and will recommend.
customer_reviews.author: P. Sen

customer_reviews.title: Powerful yet simple and easy to clean!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and clean. Made a great steak run first day it was received!
customer_reviews.author: Judy Younger

customer_reviews.title: Bad grinder for grinding rice. Anyone has any good suggestion?
customer_reviews.text: I tried to make some rice flour, but the motor shut down and unit get hot. It starts again when cool down. I may return this and look for another good one as making rice flour is my main goal of buying. Anyone has any suggestions? Need to be a electrical equipment.
customer_reviews.author: babus

customer_reviews.title: Effective, simple ... but wanting for a few small revisions
customer_reviews.text: Works well, and relatively easy to clean; however, the seal at the top allows a bit of overflow out of the intended confinement volume, if you're finely grinding your spices. The plastic appeared cloudy after only a couple uses.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Fanelli

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent product. We use spices specially coriander powder a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. We use spices specially coriander powder a lot. My wife always wanted something which can grind it fresh in small quantities. This product completely satisfied our needs. 👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Sandeep

customer_reviews.title: You can always trust Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.text: This was a shower gift for a friend, and it was well received. I paired it with a gift card to a local spice shop.
customer_reviews.author: Kathyngs

customer_reviews.title: best buy !!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy that I bought this to grind raw spices - perfect texture and that enhances the flavor and aroma in cooked dishes. Now I almost detest all the packaged spices I used to use before, they seems so artificial now. A 'must have's in your kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: muhammad nafisur rahman

customer_reviews.title: I use this for grinding dried peppers to make chili ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this for grinding dried peppers to make chili powder. Do not suggest trying to smell your results immediately afterward.
customer_reviews.author: TSU

customer_reviews.title: Very Light and delicate duty item.
customer_reviews.text: It works great. But remember it is very light duty. It is not meant for medium or heavy duty. I just grinded 1/4 pound of dry spice. And they were not that hard either. And it is already gone. So if u are trying to grind like coffee in the morning just for 1 or 2 person then great but if u want to grind whole bag don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: tejinder S. Kalra

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to remove the grinding cup from base...
customer_reviews.text: Doing a good job but problems removing the grinder cup and blade from the base to clean. Not an easy on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Georgio55

customer_reviews.title: Yes, the motor burns out
customer_reviews.text: As many other readers have mentioned, this is a fantastic product. . .until it dies. Even light use as suggested in the manual can cause the motor to overheat and die. Needed to negotiate for return. I am a spice geek, so very disappointed and wondering what the best replacement is.
customer_reviews.author: Nynaeve Al'Meara

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal as pill crusher
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use as pill crusher. It is very effective turning non-coated pills to powder but it aerosolizes so it’s blown all over inside and medication is lost. Don’t recommend for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product! Grinds coffee beans in seconds for the ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! Grinds coffee beans in seconds for the best coffee I ever had. its fairly quiet and very quick to grind. I love the cap to store my ground coffee and have easy access to make more.
customer_reviews.author: Hyun Kim Jr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect nut grinder.
customer_reviews.text: I use this grinder for a variety of nuts. It works very good and it’s easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Val M

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy unless you want “powder”.
customer_reviews.text: Can’t control the speed - forget that it chops nuts. It demolished them!
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this grinder. It grinds both roughly if desired or very fine like a powder. It is also super quiet. Super happy with my purchase !
customer_reviews.author: D C

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother to help grind up her calcium to make it easier to take. She has only been using it 11 days and the rubber top is falling apart and getting ground in with her pills. Very disappointed in this product!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Ziebell

customer_reviews.title: ... also to pulvarize some legumes used in thai receipe like peanute and coarse almonds
customer_reviews.text: It is abest machine to grind nuts and also to pulvarize some legumes used in thai receipe like peanute and coarse almonds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Went though three of those in four years, the ...
customer_reviews.text: Went though three of those in four years, the blade breaks, I use it to grind chaga, it is tough but I use very small chunks
customer_reviews.author: elena bourakovsky

customer_reviews.title: Broke after light use
customer_reviews.text: I liked it when it worked for about ten batches of light use grinding the herbs and some dry chili peppers. Then it just quit.... no overheating or any other warning sign. just quit. and, of course, i cannot return it, because I bought it in August...
customer_reviews.author: South Pole Cat

customer_reviews.title: Very good grinder.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this grinder. Easy to use. grind very fine. I use it to grind herbs and it really does the work.
customer_reviews.author: MAVCOL

customer_reviews.title: a good product
customer_reviews.text: i’v had this for a few years, its great, i use it for flax seeds, to grind dried fruit to a paste, to flour nuts, and to powder herbs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst product.. v disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It’s been only a month we got this product and have used only 3 times and its not working anymore.. it just doesnt work.. not finding any way to return this product.. seems hv to go thro the hassle of customer service.. v v v disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Saikat Roychowdhury

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for over two years and use daily to grind coffee beans. I only put in enough beans to just cover the blades.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. ROBERTS

customer_reviews.title: Weak and Fragile Motor
customer_reviews.text: I used it to grind candle nuts, onions, and garlic. Until I smell something like burning rubber.. and then the grinder was broken and useless... Just small tips: use it carefully... just make sure to do a start-stop grinder in interval of 10 seconds... and always check also the temperature of the body by touching it... if it starts to get warm... give it some time to cool down... if you force to run the motor too long, you will break it...
customer_reviews.author: wibisono

customer_reviews.title: Worthless, even at Zero cost
customer_reviews.text: The lousy unit gets easily stuck whereby you can not remove the bowl to clean it or use it. Junk design and build.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

product_meta.title: Cuisinart SG-10 Electric Spice-and-Nut Grinder, Stainless/Black
product_meta.description:
There's nothing quite like the smell and taste of freshly ground spices. And with the Cuisinart Spice and Nut Grinder it's easier than ever to efficiently rind any spice or create original, tantalizing spice blends. The blade is exclusively designed to grid spices and nuts and the simple press-down lid starts the grinding process with one touch, sealing in all the finely ground spices.

Note:Please make sure the lid is locked in place and the appropriate amount of spices are loaded in the unit Features: Specially designed stainless steel blades for spice and nut grinding|200 watt motor|Push-top on/off control for simple operation|Built-in safety interlock prevents operation unless the lid is securely in place|Bowl holds up to 90g|Heavy-duty motor and stainless steel blades|Dishwasher-safe lid and removable stainless steel bowl|Storage lid allows for extra spices to be stored in the grinding bowl|Nonslip rubber feet|Instruction/ recipe book|Limited 18-month product warranty|BPA Free
feature_bullets: Electric spice-and-nut grinder with durable stainless-steel blades
Heavy-duty motor; push-top lid for simple on/off control
Bowl holds 90 grams; extra storage space in lid; nonslip rubber feet
Dishwasher-safe lid and bowl; instruction manual with recipes included
Product Built to North American Electrical Standards

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,141 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
